Body:
I am trying to use this tutorial Connect Raspberry Pi to Azure IoT Hub (Node.js)

It is about connecting from Raspberry-Pi to Azure IoT.

But I found error like this:

pi@raspberrypi:~/iot-hub-node-raspberrypi-client-app $ sudo node index.js 'HostName=CarHub.azure-devices.net;DeviceId=CarDevice;SharedAccessKey=oVxb0JUFrJPIeJy+gk5HnAW75GUo7c+u+Xt'		{[Error: ETIMEDOUT
column11:
syscall: 'writeByte'} get twin message error get twin message error get twin message error

Maybe someone knows how to make it right? How to make the tutorial works? Thank you very much before.

When I iothub_explorer list
column12:
it shows like this:

"

Body:
You can check azure iot hub connection using iothub explorer CLI tool on Raspberry Pi.

  1. Install iothub explorer CLI tool: sudo npm install -g iothub-explorer
  2. Login: iothub-explorer login PUT YOUR IOTHUB CONNECTION STRING HERE"
  3. Run this command and show us the result:iothub-explorer list
"
Han, as I edited the posting
Han, Sorry it was not mine. I just made correction by my own, but it is still the same.
@caknizar You can check [this issue](https://github.com/Azure/azure-event-hubs-node/issues/12) and do some attempts.
I found your device id is CarDevice" why you use "new-device"? And hub names are also different
